nodes.title: Update 1.2 for Yupitergrad is out now!

node.reviewDescription:
This game is awesome, a lot of replay ability and the controls are wonderful (may take time to get used to though) I’m not good at reviewing games thoroughly, but trust me when I say you will have good time playing this game. 

P.S. devs if you’re reading this, there aren’t many places you can just swing around and enjoy the physics, maybe add a playground mode? A large mostly open zone with some floating structures to grapple onto, some place to get more used to the controls than just the tutorial zone. This is a great game but I feel like the mechanics are kind of wasted without a large open zone to REALLY mess around and have fun with the grapples.  Thank you for reading :)

website_page_meta.description: Yupitergrad is the plunger-driven kosmonaut game where you can swing through space station with style all in cell-shaded graphics. Can you believe that grappling hooks is the definitive way of locomotion in place like this? It's one of a kind experience, where VR platformer meets puzzles in a single player campaign. It also gives you arcade thrills with Time Attack mode. All of this is soaked in delicious dieselpunk sauce.
website_page_meta.title: Yupitergrad · Oculus Quest
